item.title: Cy add a quote by Arnold Ehret
item.description: "Life is a tragedy of nutrition" -- Arnold Ehret

item.title: Cy add a quote by Eduardo Galeano
item.description: "El subdesarrollo no es una etapa del desarrollo. Es su consecuencia." -- Eduardo Galeano

item.title: Cy add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "[Kids] don't remember what you try to teach them. They remember what you are." -- Jim Henson

item.title: Cy add a quote by Frantz Fanon
item.description: "Violence is man re-creating himself. " -- Frantz Fanon

item.title: Cy add a quote by Billy Corgan
item.description: "I've always been spiritual but I've never had a proper context, and it took me a while to find the proper context. It's hard to realize you can have any kind of relationship with God you want... and so I now have a punk rock relationship with God" -- Billy Corgan

item.title: Cy add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "But the true feminist deals out of a lesbian consciousness whether or not she ever sleeps with women." -- Audre Lorde

item.title: Cy add a quote by Jamaica Kincaid
item.description: "The night-soil men can see a bird walking in trees. It isn't a bird. It is a woman who has removed her skin and is on her way to drink the blood of her secret enemies. It is a woman who has left her skin i a corner of a house made out of wood. It is a woman who is reasonable and admires honeybees in the hibiscus." -- Jamaica Kincaid

item.title: Cy add a quote by Dave Hill
item.description: "It is as though they simply cannot contemplate the notion of a short, slight man who dresses and moves like a popular (mis)conception of a homosexual being attractive to millions of women." -- Dave Hill

item.title: Cy add a quote by Octavio Paz
item.description: "Mineral cactai, quicksilver lizards in the adobe walls, the bird that punctures space, thirst, tedium, clouds of dust, impalpable epiphanies of wind. The pines taught me to talk to myself. In that garden I learnedto send myself off. Later there were no gardens. " -- Octavio Paz

item.title: Cy add a quote by Edwidge Danticat
item.description: "No, women like you don't write. They carve onion sculptures and potato statues. They sit in dark corners and braid their hair in new shapes and twists in order to control the stiffness, the unruliness, the rebelliousness." -- Edwidge Danticat

item.title: Cy add a quote by Fela Anikulapo Kuti
item.description: "It was when I was in a police cell at the C.I.D. (Central Intelligence Division) headquarters in Lagos; the cell I was in named "The Kalakuta Republic" by the prisoners. I found out when I went to East Africa that "Kalakuta" is a Swahili word that means "rascal." So if rascality is going to get us what we want, we will use it; because we are dealing with corrupt people, we have to be rascally with them." -- Fela Anikulapo Kuti

item.title: Cy add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "A dead hydrangea is as intricate and lovely as one in bloom. Bleak sky is as seductive as sunshine, miniature orange trees without blossom or fruit are not defective; they are that." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Cy add a quote by Octavio Paz
item.description: "a silent concave of puppet buffoons neither eagles nor jaguars buzzard lawyers locuses wings of ink sawing mindibles ventriloquist coyotes peddlers of shadows beneficent satraps the cacomistle thief of hens the monument to the Rattle and its snake the altar to the mauser and the machete the mausoleum of the epauletted cayman rhetoric sculpted in phrases of cement" -- Octavio Paz

item.title: Cy add a quote by Rebecca Walker
item.description: "It seems to me, that this, too, is how memory works. What we remember of what was done to us shapes our view, molds us, sets our stance. But what we remember is past, it no longer exists, and yet we hold on to it, live by it, surrender so much control to it. What do we become when we put down the scripts written by history and memory, when each person before us can be seen free of the cultural or personal narrative we've inherited or devised? When we, ourselves, can taste that freedom." -- Rebecca Walker

item.title: Cy add a quote by Zadie Smith
item.description: "Boys are just boys after all, but sometimes girls really seem to be the turn of a pale wrist, or the sudden jut of a hip, or a clutch of very dark hair falling across a freckled forehead. I'm not saying that's what they really are. I'm just saying sometimes it seems that way, and that those details (a thigh mole, a full face flush, a scar the precise shape and size of a cashew nut) are so many hooks waiting to land you." -- Zadie Smith

item.title: Cy add a quote by Keri Hulme
item.description: "I am in limbo, and in limbo there are no races, no prizes, no changes, no chances. There are merely degrees of endurance, and endurance never was my strong point." -- Keri Hulme

item.title: Cy add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "The erotic is a measure between the beginnings of our sense of self and the chaos of our strongest feelings. " -- Audre Lorde

item.title: Cy add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "No other continent has endured such an unspeakably bizarre combination of foreign thievery and foreign goodwill." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Cy add a quote by Marcus Garvey
item.description: "I regard the Klan, the Anglo-Saxon clubs and White American societies, as far as the Negro is concerned, as better friends of the race than all other groups of hypocritical whites put together." -- Marcus Garvey

item.title: Cy add a quote by Frantz Fanon
item.description: "Imperialism leaves behind germs of rot which we must clinically detect and remove from our land but from our minds as well." -- Frantz Fanon

item.title: Cy add a quote by Nawal El Saadawi
item.description: "Yet not for a single moment did I have any doubts about my own integrity and honour as a woman. I knew that my profession had been invented by men, and that men were in control of both our worlds, the one on earth, and the one in heaven. That men force women to sell their bodies at a price, and that the lowest paid body is that of a wife. All women are prostitutes of one kind or another." -- Nawal El Saadawi

item.title: Cy add a quote by Gloria Anzaldua
item.description: "The struggle is inner: Chicano, indio, American Indian, mojado, mexicano, immigrant Latino, Anglo in power, working class Anglo, Black, Asian--our psyches resemble the bordertowns and are populated by the same people. The struggle has always been inner, and is played out in outer terrains. Awareness of our situation must come before inner changes, which in turn come before changes in society. Nothing happens in the "real" world unless it first happens in the images in our heads. (G. Anzaldua Tejana Chicana poet, 1942- )" -- Gloria Anzaldua

item.title: Cy add a quote by Octavio Paz
item.description: "It is always difficult to give oneself up; few persons anywhere ever succeed in doing so, and even fewer transcend the possessive stage to know love for what it actually is: a perpetual discovery, and immersion in the waters of reality, an unending re-creation." -- Octavio Paz

item.title: Cy add a quote by Dick Gregory
item.description: "I personally believe breathatarianism to be the highest mode of human living [...] breathing in pure air, absorbing the direct light and energies of the sun, bathing in pure water [...] I look at the obituaries every morning and ain't nobody listed but you eaters." -- Dick Gregory

item.title: Cy add a quote by Dick Gregory
item.description: "I never learned hate at home or shame. I had to go to school for that." -- Dick Gregory

item.title: Cy add a quote by Sandra Rodriguez Barron
item.description: "If you go to the craft market you will see them everywhere. They represent the mix of cultures and races here in the Dominican Republic, that are the result of centuries of international commerce, colonization, conquest, and the slave trade. The facelessness means that there is no 'typical' Dominican woman." -- Sandra Rodriguez Barron

item.title: Cy add a quote by Junot Díaz
item.description: "My African roots made me what I am today. They’re the reason I’m from the Dominican Republic. They’re the reason I exist at all. To these roots I owe everything." -- Junot Díaz

item.title: Cy add a quote by Paul Farmer
item.description: "WL’s [White Liberals] think all the world’s problems can be fixed without any cost to themselves. We don’t believe that. There’s a lot to be said for sacrifice, remorse, even pity. It’s what separates us from roaches" -- Paul Farmer

item.title: Cy add a quote by Frantz Fanon
item.description: "When we revolt it’s not for a particular culture. We revolt simply because, for many reasons, we can no longer breathe" -- Frantz Fanon

item.title: Cy add a quote by Zadie Smith
item.description: "When a human being becomes a set of data on a website like Facebook, he or she is reduced. Everything shrinks. Individual character. Friendships. Language. Sensibility. In a way it’s a transcendent experience: we lose our bodies, our messy feelings, our desires, our fears." -- Zadie Smith
